Question
========

The variable age is skewed in the population of psychology students distributed with mean 26.5 and standard deviation 9.2. What is the probability that in a *random sample* of 30 individuals a mean age less than 25 is found?

Answerlist
----------

* 0.19
* 0.44
* 0.56

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.19: Incorrect
* 0.44: Correct
* 0.56: Incorrect
